intro: Ainsliaea caobangensis, commonly known as the Caobang ainsliaea, is a flowering plant native to Vietnam. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or white. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
